item.title: WebRTC and VOIP
item.description: Real-time Audio in Ubiq is supported by WebRTC. WebRTC is the media stack supporting RTC (real-time communication) in modern web-browsers. WebRTC allows Ubiq to interoperate with browsers and second-party native applications on multiple platforms. WebRTC supports everything required for RTC except signalling, by design. The WebRTC native libraries make their own P2P connections using ICE, and drive the audio devices. Ubiq exchanges signalling messages on behalf of the media stack to support this.
